description.narrative: By 2020 national capacity to reveal and monitor bottlenecks in realization of children's rights strengthened

mailing-address.narrative: 22A Krasnoarmejskaya Street 220030 Minsk Republic of Belarus

title.narrative: Belarus United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020 national capacity to reveal and monitor bottlenecks in realization of children’s rights strengthened

description.narrative: Investment in research and analytics, support of child-related data generation and establishment of strategic partnerships strengthened the national capacity to monitor bottlenecks in the realization of child rights. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/12/2019

title.narrative: # of child rights related monitoring tools for budgeting and planning are produced and adopted by # local administrations (Target: 2 tools child-budgeting tool & enhanced CAFC indicator database, in 3 cities) (AMP-Programme)

# advocacy initiatives on child rights strengthened through enhance knowledge generation (Target: 3 advocacy initiatives with the Parliament and line ministries conducted with dedicated policy briefs)
MICS6 generated disaggregated data for decision-making, SDG and child rights monitoring. AMP indicator

actual.value: 2019:MICS data output tables were reviewed by HQ and RO during the pre-DIRC in-Country Technical Assistance Mission on 10-15 November. UNICEF and Belstat team have prepared eight MICS Statistical Snapshots to be finalized and disseminated during MICS Survey Findings Report launch.

title.narrative: Evidence generated on budgets and their linkages to child outcomes to improve budget allocations/expenditure for children

target.value: 2019:Evidence generated to identify how much public expenditures benefit children and adolescents

actual.value: 2019:CEQ4C in-depth fiscal incidence analysis with an estimate of Multidimensional Child Poverty (MDCP) in Belarus is done. In 2019 MoF has officially presented its first estimate of a Child budget that reached 7.6% of GDP in 2018 and an outlook is 8.1% for 2020.

title.narrative: Universal data-portal on child-related statistics in line with international standards developed

target.value: 2019:The universal data-portal is tested and available for public use

actual.value: 2019:The universal data-portal on child-related statistics was launched, registered by the Ministry of Information as an official state information resource and presented at TransMonEE meeting (Vienna) in November as a regional best practice

title.narrative: Existence of functional interactive child rights monitoring dashboard on key child deprivations, including national and regional SDG indicators (with at least 250 users by end December 2020)
